toc_entry.title: Big River
toc_entry.description: A photographic tour of the timeless Rio Grande, from its origins in the mountains of Colorado to the Padre Island dunes at the tip of Texas.
toc_entry.byline: Jim Bones, Jr., and John Graves

toc_entry.title: The Horny Toad
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: It’s everybody’s favorite reptile, and it’s disappearing from Texas.

toc_entry.title: Growing Up Fast
toc_entry.description: Every parent with a teenage kid knows the fears: drinking, drugs, and rebellion. For the Cartwrights, those fears all came true.

toc_entry.title: His Name Was Forrest Bess
toc_entry.description: He was wildly eccentric, he lived in a shanty on the Gulf, he subsisted as a bait fisherman, he had bizarre notions of eternal life. He may have been the best artist Texas has ever produced.

toc_entry.title: A Singin’ Fool
toc_entry.description: George Jones really lives the way he says he lives in the songs he sings.

toc_entry.title: The Bishop Drops a Bomb
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: When an amarillo bishop decried the nearby H-bomb plant, he wooed the press, alienated the city, and picked on his parishioners.

toc_entry.title: Cool Blue And Dangerous
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Diva is about opera, punks, and philosophy. Oh, and young love. And bootlegging, too. Then there’s the chase scene. . . . The British film The Long Good Friday is a bloody good depiction of the underworld. Cat People is a dog.

toc_entry.title: The Proving Ground
toc_entry.subtitle: Crime
toc_entry.description: Probation gives criminals a chance to show society that they can stay straight. Probation officers like Jan Purdom believe the system works.

toc_entry.title: Hands Across the Ocean
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: British playwright alan ayckbourn dropped in on his american cousins at Houston’s alley Theatre and directed the U.S. premiere of his latest and most innovative work.

toc_entry.title: Mustard Seeds
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: Ninety-four per cent of americans believe in God. That and other gleanings from recent polls reveal that the nation’s faith is stronger than ever.

toc_entry.title: Twelve-Pack To Go
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: A dozen new releases by everyone from the late, legendary Janis Joplin to rising star Rodney Crowell to perennial favorite Waylon Jennings.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: The secret of making money; the cutest vandals you ever saw; the lowdown on high tech; the little trains that couldn’t; the champ with shear magic.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Detroit attacks Houston; UT defends against the NCAA; Texas loses 59 parks to Reaganomics; voter apathy—who cares?
